metadata.topic: RE: A Practical Guide to PrintNightmare in 2024
metadata.subject: [patchmanagement] RE: A Practical Guide to PrintNightmare in 2024
metadata.email_text_original:
You don't often get email from araff@hspop.com. Learn why this is important
[https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification] 
Thank You Susan 
From: 'Susan Bradley' via PatchManagement <patchmanagement@googlegroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, January 31, 2024 4:03 PM
To: patchmanagement@googlegroups.com
Subject: [patchmanagement] A Practical Guide to PrintNightmare in 2024 
https://itm4n.github.io/printnightmare-exploitation/
[https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fitm4n.github.io%2Fprintnightmare-exploitation%2F&data=05%7C02%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7Cefad9e0d60444f78690608dc233a11a0%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638423979543404674%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=SBEzaHgSo5YvZszdJlbb%2B%2FVpsjykBacwq2HvJVEoAlM%3D&reserved=0] 
Although PrintNightmare and its variants were theoretically all addressed by
Microsoft, it is still affecting organizations to this date, mainly because of
quite confusing group policies and settings. In this blog post, I want to shed a
light on those configuration issues, and hopefully provide clear guidance on how
to remediate them. 
--
Link: https://groups.google.com/d/msgid/patchmanagement/MN0PR18MB6071ADE76EA148E242C3AD66B3432%40MN0PR18MB6071.namprd18.prod.outlook.com
